page.title: 14ECOLOGY IN AREA
page.content: 9O feet above sea level. Soil - lias clay bluish in colour and very heavy. Water naturally hard (leaves blue stains on china and lime deposits in kettles and plumbing). {Trees}- ash, willow, fruit, sycamore {Crops}- cereals, fruit, market gardening, sheep, a few beef or store cattle. {Wild flowers}- thistle, teasel, rest- harrow, cowslip, hemp agrimony, and all the usual ones. {Birds}- kestrels, collared doves, yellow bunting,heron, woodpecker (green and spotted), treecreepers, little and barn owls, kingfishers, and all the other usual birds. {Mammals}- hare, fox, evidence of badger, hedgehog, mink was seen when Piddle brook was dredged recently. {Fish}-eels.
